SEARCH
Package ca.ualberta.compileorcry.features.mood.model

Class FollowHelper

java.lang.Object
ca.ualberta.compileorcry.features.mood.model.FollowHelper
public class FollowHelper extends Object
A helper class for managing user follow relationships and follow requests using Firebase Firestore. This class provides functionality to retrieve followers, followings, and follow requests, as well as handle follow request creation, acceptance, and denial.

All methods in this class execute Firestore operations asynchronously using an ExecutorService and return null in case of executor failure or timeout (10 seconds). It is crucial for callers to check for null returns and handle potential InterruptedExceptions.

Typical usage includes:

  • Retrieving lists of followers/followings for profile display
  • Managing follow requests for private accounts
  • Updating relationship status between users

This class automatically cleans up invalid follower/following documents that don't contain valid username strings.

See Also:
  • FirebaseFirestore
  • ExecutorService
  • User

  • Method Details

    • getFollowers

      public static ArrayList<String> getFollowers(String username) throws InterruptedException
      Used to get a list of all followers of a user. Check if the return is null, as it returns null in the event of a executor failure.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user who you want to get their followers
      Returns:
      a list of username of the people who follow the user
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • unfollowUser

      public static boolean unfollowUser(String user1, String user2) throws InterruptedException
      Unfollows a user. Assumes user1 is following user2.
      Parameters:
      user1 - The following user
      user2 - The user who is to be unfollowed.
      Returns:
      Returns true on success, otherwise false
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

      This is used to accept or deny follow requests
      Parameters:

      requester - The username of the person who sent the follow request
